com.habitsoft.kiyaa.views
Class WhenView

java.lang.Object
  com.habitsoft.kiyaa.views.WhenView
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class WhenView
extends Object
implements View

This is used to implement lazy conditional subview inside templates, but of course you can use it elsewhere. Set up a view factory and when the value if test is true, the view is created and shown. This class wraps its contents in a DIV, which is always around even when the inner view is not created. As a convenience, you can provide placeholder HTML to use when the test is false, for example to put an   to ensure the DIV participates in the HTML layout.

public void load(com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback callback)

setPlaceholderHtml

public void setPlaceholderHtml(String placeholderHtml)
When the view is not being shown, you can provide some placeholder HTML to display. This sets the innerHtml of this DIV when the test is false.

setPlaceholderNbsp

public void setPlaceholderNbsp(boolean useNbsp)
Some browsers eliminate DIVs from the layout process if they don't have anything inside them. Setting this to true will set the placeHolderHtml to " ".

setTest

public void setTest(boolean truth)
If passed true, the view will be constructed on the next load() if it wasn't already. If false, the view will be destroyed on the next load() if it has been constructed.

setTestNot

public void setTestNot(boolean truth)
Opposite of setTest(), may be handy when the boolean NOT operator isn't readily available.

setViewFactory

public void setViewFactory(ViewFactory viewFactory)
